channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Evaluating generation of chaotic time series by convolutional generative adversarial networks
item.description: To understand the ability and limitations of convolutional neural networks to generate time series that mimic complex temporal signals, we trained a generative adversarial network consisting of deep convolutional networks to generate chaotic time series and used nonlinear time series analysis to evaluate the generated time series.

item.title: Domain Aligned Prefix Averaging for Domain Generalization in Abstractive Summarization
item.description: These source prefixes generate summaries for a small number of target domain documents.

item.title: MixCE: Training Autoregressive Language Models by Mixing Forward and Reverse Cross-Entropies
item.description: Autoregressive language models are trained by minimizing the cross-entropy of the model distribution Q relative to the data distribution P -- that is, minimizing the forward cross-entropy, which is equivalent to maximum likelihood estimation (MLE).

item.title: Multiview Identifiers Enhanced Generative Retrieval
item.description: Instead of simply matching a query to pre-existing passages, generative retrieval generates identifier strings of passages as the retrieval target.

item.title: Dramatic Conversation Disentanglement
item.description: We present a new dataset for studying conversation disentanglement in movies and TV series.

item.title: BiomedGPT: A Unified and Generalist Biomedical Generative Pre-trained Transformer for Vision, Language, and Multimodal Tasks
item.description: In this paper, we introduce a unified and generalist Biomedical Generative Pre-trained Transformer (BiomedGPT) model, which leverages self-supervision on large and diverse datasets to accept multi-modal inputs and perform a range of downstream tasks.

item.title: A Closer Look at In-Context Learning under Distribution Shifts
item.description: In-context learning, a capability that enables a model to learn from input examples on the fly without necessitating weight updates, is a defining characteristic of large language models.

item.title: Few-shot Fine-tuning vs. In-context Learning: A Fair Comparison and Evaluation
item.description: In this paper, we compare the generalization of few-shot fine-tuning and in-context learning to challenge datasets, while controlling for the models used, the number of examples, and the number of parameters, ranging from 125M to 30B.

item.title: MultiTool-CoT: GPT-3 Can Use Multiple External Tools with Chain of Thought Prompting
item.description: Large language models (LLMs) have achieved impressive performance on various reasoning tasks.

item.title: CRoSS: Diffusion Model Makes Controllable, Robust and Secure Image Steganography
item.description: Current image steganography techniques are mainly focused on cover-based methods, which commonly have the risk of leaking secret images and poor robustness against degraded container images.

item.title: Adaptive PD Control using Deep Reinforcement Learning for Local-Remote Teleoperation with Stochastic Time Delays
item.description: By adjusting controller parameters in real-time, this adaptive controller compensates for stochastic delays and improves synchronicity between local and remote robotic manipulators.

item.title: An Empirical Comparison of LM-based Question and Answer Generation Methods
item.description: This task has a variety of applications, such as data augmentation for question answering (QA) models, information retrieval and education.

item.title: On Evaluating Adversarial Robustness of Large Vision-Language Models
item.description: Large vision-language models (VLMs) such as GPT-4 have achieved unprecedented performance in response generation, especially with visual inputs, enabling more creative and adaptable interaction than large language models such as ChatGPT.

item.title: Free Lunch: Robust Cross-Lingual Transfer via Model Checkpoint Averaging
item.description: The results indicate that averaging model checkpoints yields systematic and consistent performance gains across diverse target languages in all tasks.

item.title: An Investigation of Noise in Morphological Inflection
item.description: We aim at closing this gap by investigating the types of noise encountered within a pipeline for truly unsupervised morphological paradigm completion and its impact on morphological inflection systems: First, we propose an error taxonomy and annotation pipeline for inflection training data.

item.title: Large Language Models as Tool Makers
item.description: Our approach consists of two key phases: 1) tool making: an LLM acts as the tool maker that crafts tools for given tasks, where a tool is implemented as a Python utility function.

item.title: SSSegmenation: An Open Source Supervised Semantic Segmentation Toolbox Based on PyTorch
item.description: This paper presents SSSegmenation, which is an open source supervised semantic image segmentation toolbox based on PyTorch.

item.title: CREST: A Joint Framework for Rationalization and Counterfactual Text Generation
item.description: Selective rationales and counterfactual examples have emerged as two effective, complementary classes of interpretability methods for analyzing and training NLP models.

item.title: A Hierarchical Approach to Population Training for Human-AI Collaboration
item.description: A major challenge for deep reinforcement learning (DRL) agents is to collaborate with novel partners that were not encountered by them during the training phase.

item.title: Hierarchical Verbalizer for Few-Shot Hierarchical Text Classification
item.description: Due to the complex label hierarchy and intensive labeling cost in practice, the hierarchical text classification (HTC) suffers a poor performance especially when low-resource or few-shot settings are considered.

item.title: Confidence-Based Feature Imputation for Graphs with Partially Known Features
item.description: To overcome this limitation, we introduce a novel concept of channel-wise confidence in a node feature, which is assigned to each imputed channel feature of a node for reflecting certainty of the imputation.

item.title: S4M: Generating Radiology Reports by A Single Model for Multiple Body Parts
item.description: In this paper, we seek to design a report generation model that is able to generate reasonable reports even given different images of various body parts.

item.title: Meta-prediction Model for Distillation-Aware NAS on Unseen Datasets
item.description: Previous DaNAS methods have mostly tackled the search for the neural architecture for fixed datasets and the teacher, which are not generalized well on a new task consisting of an unseen dataset and an unseen teacher, thus need to perform a costly search for any new combination of the datasets and the teachers.

item.title: Extremely weakly-supervised blood vessel segmentation with physiologically based synthesis and domain adaptation
item.description: Accurate analysis and modeling of renal functions require a precise segmentation of the renal blood vessels.

item.title: Learning to Imagine: Visually-Augmented Natural Language Generation
item.description: People often imagine relevant scenes to aid in the writing process.

item.title: Songs Across Borders: Singable and Controllable Neural Lyric Translation
item.description: The development of general-domain neural machine translation (NMT) methods has advanced significantly in recent years, but the lack of naturalness and musical constraints in the outputs makes them unable to produce singable lyric translations.

item.title: Controlling Learned Effects to Reduce Spurious Correlations in Text Classifiers
item.description: Therefore, using methods from the causal inference literature, we propose an algorithm to regularize the learnt effect of the features on the model's prediction to the estimated effect of feature on label.

item.title: Language Models Can Improve Event Prediction by Few-Shot Abductive Reasoning
item.description: Large language models have shown astonishing performance on a wide range of reasoning tasks.

item.title: Tree-Based Diffusion Schrödinger Bridge with Applications to Wasserstein Barycenters
item.description: In this paper, we consider an entropic version of mOT with a tree-structured quadratic cost, i. e., a function that can be written as a sum of pairwise cost functions between the nodes of a tree.

item.title: Zero is Not Hero Yet: Benchmarking Zero-Shot Performance of LLMs for Financial Tasks
item.description: Recently large language models (LLMs) like ChatGPT have shown impressive performance on many natural language processing tasks with zero-shot.

item.title: Improving Knowledge Distillation via Regularizing Feature Norm and Direction
item.description: Finally, we propose a rather simple loss term (dubbed ND loss) to simultaneously (1) encourage student to produce large-\emph{norm} features, and (2) align the \emph{direction} of student features and teacher class-means.

item.title: Training Socially Aligned Language Models in Simulated Human Society
item.description: Social alignment in AI systems aims to ensure that these models behave according to established societal values.

item.title: Dual Bayesian ResNet: A Deep Learning Approach to Heart Murmur Detection
item.description: The second model is the output of DBRes integrated with demographic data and signal features using XGBoost. DBRes achieved our best weighted accuracy of $0. 771$ on the hidden test set for murmur classification, which placed us fourth for the murmur task.

item.title: UMSE: Unified Multi-scenario Summarization Evaluation
item.description: Experimental results across three typical scenarios on the benchmark dataset SummEval indicate that our UMSE can achieve comparable performance with several existing strong methods which are specifically designed for each scenario.

item.title: NeuroX Library for Neuron Analysis of Deep NLP Models
item.description: The Python toolkit is available at https://www. github. com/fdalvi/NeuroX.

item.title: Teamwork Is Not Always Good: An Empirical Study of Classifier Drift in Class-incremental Information Extraction
item.description: Class-incremental learning (CIL) aims to develop a learning system that can continually learn new classes from a data stream without forgetting previously learned classes.

item.title: Geometric deep learning approach to knot theory
item.description: In this paper, we introduce a novel way to use geometric deep learning for knot data by constructing a functor that takes knots to graphs and using graph neural networks.

item.title: Improving Position Encoding of Transformers for Multivariate Time Series Classification
item.description: We then proposed a new absolute position encoding method dedicated to time series data called time Absolute Position Encoding (tAPE).

item.title: Future-conditioned Unsupervised Pretraining for Decision Transformer
item.description: While promising, return conditioning is limited to training data labeled with rewards and therefore faces challenges in learning from unsupervised data.

item.title: A Reminder of its Brittleness: Language Reward Shaping May Hinder Learning for Instruction Following Agents
item.description: Teaching agents to follow complex written instructions has been an important yet elusive goal.

item.title: Modulate Your Spectrum in Self-Supervised Learning
item.description: We show that whitening transformation is a special instance of ST by definition, and there exist other instances that can avoid collapse by our empirical investigation.

item.title: Score-balanced Loss for Multi-aspect Pronunciation Assessment
item.description: With rapid technological growth, automatic pronunciation assessment has transitioned toward systems that evaluate pronunciation in various aspects, such as fluency and stress.

item.title: Zero-shot Visual Question Answering with Language Model Feedback
item.description: In this paper, we propose a novel language model guided captioning approach, LAMOC, for knowledge-based visual question answering (VQA).

item.title: Sentence-Incremental Neural Coreference Resolution
item.description: We propose a sentence-incremental neural coreference resolution system which incrementally builds clusters after marking mention boundaries in a shift-reduce method.

item.title: Finspector: A Human-Centered Visual Inspection Tool for Exploring and Comparing Biases among Foundation Models
item.description: Pre-trained transformer-based language models are becoming increasingly popular due to their exceptional performance on various benchmarks.

item.title: Levin Tree Search with Context Models
item.description: Levin Tree Search (LTS) is a search algorithm that makes use of a policy (a probability distribution over actions) and comes with a theoretical guarantee on the number of expansions before reaching a goal node, depending on the quality of the policy.

item.title: NLP Reproducibility For All: Understanding Experiences of Beginners
item.description: As natural language processing (NLP) has recently seen an unprecedented level of excitement, and more people are eager to enter the field, it is unclear whether current research reproducibility efforts are sufficient for this group of beginners to apply the latest developments.

item.title: Graph Neural Convection-Diffusion with Heterophily
item.description: Graph neural networks (GNNs) have shown promising results across various graph learning tasks, but they often assume homophily, which can result in poor performance on heterophilic graphs.

item.title: Automatic Tuning of Loss Trade-offs without Hyper-parameter Search in End-to-End Zero-Shot Speech Synthesis
item.description: With our framework, we show superior performance compared to baselines in zero-shot TTS and VC, achieving state-of-the-art performance.

item.title: Schema-Guided User Satisfaction Modeling for Task-Oriented Dialogues
item.description: Further, it employs a fulfillment representation layer for learning how many task attributes have been fulfilled in the dialogue, an importance predictor component for calculating the importance of task attributes.
